p: The oxidative degradation of lipids and some other molecules is one of the main factors limiting the shelf-life of food products. In recent years, several undesirable disorders have been detected as side-effects of using commonly used synthetic antioxidants. Using a multiple-method approach, the authors of [ 79] evaluated the antioxidant ability of oregano ( Origanum vulgare), thyme ( Thymus vulgaris), rosemary ( Rosmarinus officinalis), sage ( Salvia officinalis), and clove ( Syzygium aromaticum) essential oils [ 79].
